hypothesis_content.title: BTC-ETH Cointegration Breakout Pairs Trade
hypothesis_content.statement: When the BTC/ETH price ratio deviates by more than 2.5 standard deviations from its 30-day rolling mean, a mean-reverting pairs trade will generate positive returns within 5 trading days when entered during NEUTRAL or BULL regimes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: BTC and ETH maintain strong long-term correlation during neutral/bull regimes. Extreme deviations typically correct due to arbitrage activity and portfolio rebalancing. The 30-day window captures recent market structure while avoiding excessive lookback bias.
entry_conditions: 30-day rolling correlation between BTC and ETH > 0.7
Spread width at 90th percentile of 30-day range

exit_conditions.take_profit: Spread returns to within 0.5 standard deviations of mean
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Spread widens to 4.0 standard deviations from mean

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of trades hit stop-loss before take-profit during NEUTRAL regimes, or Sharpe ratio < 0.5 in backtest.
